content.question: Which of the following graphs, if any, shows the angular velocity <math alttext="omega" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Ï‰</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the pulley as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> after the block is released from rest?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph of a line in the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, the vertical axis is labeled omega and the origin O. No numbers are indicated. The line begins on the vertical axis about half way up the axis and moves horizontally to the right.

The figure presents a graph of a line in the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, the vertical axis is labeled omega and the origin O. There are no numbers indicated. The line begins at the origin and moves up and to the right at a constant rate bisecting the coordinate plane.

The figure presents a graph of a line in the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, the vertical axis is labeled omega and the origin O. There are no numbers indicated. The line begins at the origin and moves upward and to the right at an increasing rate.

The figure presents a graph of a line in the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, the vertical axis is labeled omega and the origin O. The line begins on the vertical axis at the top of the axis and moves downward and to the right at a constant rate. The line ends on the horizontal axis at the right end of the axis.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph of a line in the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, the vertical axis is labeled omega and the origin O. There are no numbers indicated. The line begins at the origin and moves up and to the right at a constant rate bisecting the coordinate plane.

topic.text: 5.6: Newton's Second Law in Rotational Form

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
